revised_title: Recent Biosynthetic Studies on Penicillin and Cephalosporin Antibiotics
tldr: This article discusses recent experimental observations on the cell-free formation of penicillins and cephalosporins in protoplast lysates from C. acremonium. The authors describe the conversion of radiolabeled penicillin N into deacetoxycephalosporin C and propose a general mechanism for these conversions. The study also examines the possible mechanisms of penicillin and cephalosporin biosynthesis, suggesting that oxygenase activity on small peptides may be responsible for these processes.
